intro: Gymnostoma vitiense, commonly known as the Vitiense Gymnostoma, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
